availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Shrout (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Moore Shrout. Father of Margaret Shrout, Isaac Newton Shrout, Anne Shrout, Martha Shrout, Lew Shrout, and John Shrout. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Owned Charles [Unknown] in Bath County in 1858. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860, including Jane [Unknown]. Justice of the peace in Bath County in 1863.
